thread.title: Second successive 64 sees Andy Sullivan move clear in Portugal Masters
thread.title_full: Second successive 64 sees Andy Sullivan move clear in Portugal Masters

title: Second successive 64 sees Andy Sullivan move clear in Portugal Masters
text:
Second successive 64 sees Andy Sullivan move clear in Portugal Masters 16 Oct 2015 13:31:52 
comments 
England's Andy Sullivan moved out in front on his own at the Portugal Masters after a second successive 64 at the Oceanico Victoria Golf Club in Vilamoura. 
The 29-year-old, who is aiming to become the first player to win three European Tour events this season after victories in South Africa, set the clubhouse lead at 14 under. 
That put him four ahead of his nearest rival and seven ahead of fellow overnight co-leader Nicolas Colsaerts, who was among the afternoon starters. 
Scoring was good again among the early groups with Austrian Bernd Wiesberger moving into joint second place on 10 under, and Southport's Tommy Fleetwood, in reaching nine under, also matching Sullivan's best round of the morning. 
A birdie at his first hole, the 406-yard 10th, set him on his way and he picked up three further shots before the turn with three additional birdies coming over the front nine. 
"It's always nice to back up a good score with a new one," said Sullivan. 
"Sometimes it's quite tough to go out there and back it up after shooting a low one yesterday but I played much in the same vein as I did yesterday. 
"I felt really confident out there, tapped the flags again and putted with heart again. 
"It is so difficult not to shoot a good a score the way I was hitting it and putting it really." 
Sullivan led by four from Spain's Eduardo de la Riva and Wiesberger, who after playing the back nine in three under spun a 63-yard lob wedge back into the hole for an eagle two at the 358-yard second and followed up with two further birdies for his seven-under round of 64. 
South Africa's Hennie Otto made a significant move with a round of 65 to catapult him into the top 10. Related Sport News
